definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: If you have to give someone something that is really large, express mail is very convenient.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要給一個人一個很大的東西，快信很有用。

sentences.english: Still, there were young men willing to ride for the Pony Express.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，仍然有年輕男士願意在驛馬快信公司當差。

sentences.english: How long will it take to Beijing by registered express airmail. ?
sentences.chinese: 用航空掛號快信寄往北京要幾天才能到達？

sentences.english: Besides riders, other people helped run the Pony Express.
sentences.chinese: 除了騎士，經營驛馬快信公司還需要其他的人手。

sentences.english: It takes about a week by general delivery and four or five days by express.
sentences.chinese: 平信約需一星期，快信需要四至五天。

sentences.english: What's the surcharge on this express letter, please?
sentences.chinese: 這封快信的附加費是多少？

sentences.english: What's the surcharge on this express letter?
sentences.chinese: 這封快信的附加費是多少錢？

sentences.english: The Pony Express was much faster than the stagecoach.
sentences.chinese: 驛馬快信要比當時的公共馬車快多了。

definition: abbr. for 信報財經新聞|信报财经新闻, Hong Kong Economic Journal
to reply/to write back/letter written in reply/CL:封[feng1]
to become more urgent/more rapid/urgent/to handle a matter urgently
ordinary mail (as opposed to air mail etc)
to send word/to deliver a letter
secret documents/abbr. for 機密文件|机密文件
